Description: Pottery ostracon: fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel. The exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of one line of black-painted hieratic text. It is an administrative text concerning grain.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: G.Brunton, 'Matmar' (London, 1948), pp.67 and 72, mentioned only ('among the rubbish from houses in the temple area').
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393597) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393597)
